repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR is related to #1772 and is an attempt at supporting `const` fused type memory views such as:

```
cimport cython
def sum(const cython.floating[:] array):
    cdef cython.floating sum = 0
    for v in array:
        sum += v
    return sum
```

Cython internals are new to me, so I don't know how far this is from a proper solution, but it's working fine from what I tested.
Let me know if it is worth spending more time on it and what can be improved.

One remark: In case of function signature like `def test(const cython.floating[:] a, cython.foating[:] b)` and mismatching input floating types, the exception is:
`TypeError: No matching signature found`
while without `const` it is: `ValueError: Buffer dtype mismatch, expected 'float' but got 'double'`

Closes #1772.

comment_data.body:
Why is this additional type necessary, instead of relying on the `CConstOrVolatileType` wrapper for this?
Using just the wrapper would be nicer because it's already integrated into the type system and also handles more cases.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1691,6 +1691,27 @@ def get_fused_types(self, result=None, seen=None):
             seen.add(self)
 
 
+class ConstFusedType(FusedType):

comment_data.body: Looks like this could be done by `unique()`, if the "type or base type" selection happens before calling it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3174,7 +3195,14 @@ def unique(somelist):
     return result
 
 def get_all_specialized_permutations(fused_types):
-    return _get_all_specialized_permutations(unique(fused_types))
+    fused_types = unique(fused_types)
+
+    # Filter out FusedType for which there is also a ConstFusedType
+    const_base_fused_types = [
+        t.base_fused_type for t in fused_types if isinstance(t, ConstFusedType)]
+    fused_types = [t for t in fused_types if t not in const_base_fused_types]

comment_data.body: We probably also need more tests for arguments with plain (non-memoryview) fused types. For example, I'd be interested in how this behaves if a fused type is defined with both a const and non-const variant of a basic C type (e.g. `int` and `const int` in the same fused type). Not sure if this should be allowed, but there should better be a test for it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,6 +362,22 @@ def test_fused_memslice_dtype_repeated_2(cython.floating[:] array1, cython.float
     """
     print cython.typeof(array1), cython.typeof(array2), cython.typeof(array3)
 
+def test_fused_const_memslice_dtype_repeated(const cython.floating[:] array1, cython.floating[:] array2):

comment_data.body:
Indeed.
Adding `subtypes = ['cv_base_type']` to `CConstOrVolatileType` makes it compatible with `FusedType` and boils down this patch to a single liner...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1691,6 +1691,27 @@ def get_fused_types(self, result=None, seen=None):
             seen.add(self)
 
 
+class ConstFusedType(FusedType):

comment_data.body: I was expecting some side effects. This is no longer needed anyway.

@@ -3174,7 +3195,14 @@ def unique(somelist):
     return result
 
 def get_all_specialized_permutations(fused_types):
-    return _get_all_specialized_permutations(unique(fused_types))
+    fused_types = unique(fused_types)
+
+    # Filter out FusedType for which there is also a ConstFusedType
+    const_base_fused_types = [
+        t.base_fused_type for t in fused_types if isinstance(t, ConstFusedType)]
+    fused_types = [t for t in fused_types if t not in const_base_fused_types]

comment_data.body: Since `const const int` leads to a "Duplicate 'const'" error during parsing, to me it would make sense that using `const` with a fused type containing a `const` type leads to an error.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,6 +362,22 @@ def test_fused_memslice_dtype_repeated_2(cython.floating[:] array1, cython.float
     """
     print cython.typeof(array1), cython.typeof(array2), cython.typeof(array3)
 
+def test_fused_const_memslice_dtype_repeated(const cython.floating[:] array1, cython.floating[:] array2):

comment_data.body:
Agreed.
What I meant, though, was, that you could define a fused type with both `int` and `const int` in it, and then use it as such (without additional `const`). Admittedly, that isn't really related to this PR, but it's worth a test.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,6 +362,22 @@ def test_fused_memslice_dtype_repeated_2(cython.floating[:] array1, cython.float
     """
     print cython.typeof(array1), cython.typeof(array2), cython.typeof(array3)
 
+def test_fused_const_memslice_dtype_repeated(const cython.floating[:] array1, cython.floating[:] array2):

comment_data.body:
This test:
```
cdef fused mix_const_t:
    int
    const int

cdef cdef_func_with_mix_const_type(mix_const_t val):
    print(val, cython.typeof(val))

def test_fused_with_mixed_const():
    """Test fused type including const and non-const types

    >>> test_fused_with_mixed_const()
    (0, 'int')
    """
    cdef int val = 0
    cdef_func_with_mix_const_type(val)
```
leads to the following errors at the line calling `cdef_func_with_mix_const_type`:
```
Invalid use of fused types, type cannot be specialized
ambiguous overloaded method
```

This looks to be because both implementations match the situation (https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py#L4444).

To me, there is not much sense to support it since `int` can be passed as `const int`, but that would probably be best to raise the error at the line of the fused type definition.

I'm adding it as an error test as it is. Let me know if this is OK.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -361,6 +362,22 @@ def test_fused_memslice_dtype_repeated_2(cython.floating[:] array1, cython.float
     """
     print cython.typeof(array1), cython.typeof(array2), cython.typeof(array3)
 
+def test_fused_const_memslice_dtype_repeated(const cython.floating[:] array1, cython.floating[:] array2):

comment_data.body: Seems ok for now, and good to have a separate error test for it, in case we want to report the error (read: a better error) earlier at some point.

Still:
> We probably also need more tests for arguments with plain (non-memoryview) fused types.

Could you add just a few for that case, please?

commit.message: add tests for const fused types in function argument
Add test for support fused type memoryview type limitation
add subtypes class attribute to CConstOrVolatileType
Update test of const fused type memory view
test fused type mixing const and non-const type
Add a test for cdef func with const fused args
add a test of indexing fused type

title: Add support of const fused type memory views
